Page 4/10: Top 10 Talent Management Trends for Organizations in 2026
Talent management trends in 2025 are being shaped by the rapid adoption of AI, a shift to skills-based frameworks, and increased reliance on data-driven personalization. As businesses respond to evolving workforce dynamics, many are moving away from traditional role-based structures toward more agile, skill-focused talent strategies.
According to SHRMâ€™s 2024 Talent Trends survey, 64% of organizations using AI in HR apply it to recruitment, interviewing, or hiring, while 43% use it to support learning and development efforts. These figures confirm that AI is no longer experimental; it is central to how companies attract, develop, and retain talent. This trend indicates that AI has become a core component in how organizations attract, develop, and retain talent.
This blog explores the top 10 talent management trends transforming the workforce in 2025, including AI-led upskilling, internal mobility, agile performance models, and employee well-being programs.
10 Key Talent Management Trends in 2025
1. Skills-Based Talent Management
Today, businesses have shifted their focus from traditional titles and roles to skills-based talent management. By doing so, companies can pick, use, and develop targeted skills to best fit their needs in achieving specific business objectives. Skills-based talent management ensures employees become agile by preparing them to respond to emerging market demands or changes.
Maintaining a comprehensive skills inventory helps identify skill gaps, deploy talent efficiently and support continuous learning. In addition to making employees more engaged, it propels organizational resilience.
2. AI and Data-driven Talent Management
Artificial intelligence and data analytics are significantly evolving talent management. As per a report by Gartner, 76% of HR leaders believe that businesses lacking solutions will have to face significant disadvantages in the next 12-24 months.
From generative AI tools that make recruitment easier to advanced analytics for better performance tracking, AI promises precision and efficiency. Additionally, it enables HR professionals to focus on strategic initiatives while taking care of mundane, regular tasks.
3. AI-Based Upskilling and Reskilling
By offering the latest and most useful recommendations, AI-powered platforms like iMocha have been revolutionizing the upskilling and reskilling process. They offer personalized learning paths based on skill gaps, career goals, and industry trends, ensuring employees get precisely what is needed to navigate a dynamic workplace.
Using AI, organizations can make data-driven training investment decisions that ensure ROI while fostering employee growth. This trend also supports a culture of lifelong learning, enabling employees to stay relevant and adaptable. Companies focusing on AI-based upskilling gain a workforce that can drive innovation and meet future challenges.
Internal mobility is picking up as organizations realize the value of unlocking talent from within. Platforms like iMocha allow companies to mobilize internal talent by mapping employees' skills to open opportunities across departments.
This trend reduces hiring costs, accelerates onboarding, and boosts employee satisfaction by offering growth opportunities. Internal mobility ensures that organizations retain institutional knowledge while fostering loyalty. It enables employees to explore various roles, which develops a dynamic workforce for companies that can handle diverse business needs.
Career pathing is becoming the cornerstone of talent management, and platforms such as iMocha allow organizations to engage and grow talent through structured career development plans.
Employees like clarity in career progression, and companies doing that are retaining their high performers. Career pathing aligns individual aspirations with organizational objectives, provides growth opportunities, and secures skill development at every point. This trend makes workforces purposefully motivated, engaged, loyal, and geared for the future. It allows organizations to ensure future success while allowing employees to achieve their potential.
6. Personalized L&D for DEI
The concept of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) has been a driving force for talent management, and personalized Learning & Development (L&D) programs for a while now. Personalized L&D programs help address the unique challenges of underrepresented groups, ensuring equal access.
Organizations can design inclusive training programs that celebrate diversity and foster equity using AI and skills platforms . Personalized L&D strengthen workplace culture and talent attraction and retention from diverse backgrounds. Organizations focusing on DEI through personalized growth opportunities will lead to innovation and inclusivity in 2025.
7. Leadership Development through Skills Analytics
Leadership development is driven by data, starting with platforms like iMocha, which uses skills analytics to identify and nurture future leaders. Organizations can design customized training programs by assessing leadership competencies to close skill gaps and enhance decision-making capabilities.
Skills analytics also enable organizations to measure the progress of leadership initiatives and align them to the business goals and objectives. Companies that invest in leadership development develop resilient, visionary leaders who keep pace with ever-changing market demands. Organizations can future-proof their leadership pipeline in the age of outstanding leadership through skills analytics.
8. Agile Performance Management
Agile performance management is replacing traditional models. Agile performance management measures talent management strategies' Return on Investment (ROI) by connecting employee contributions to organization success.
Agile performance management reveals high-performing talent, confronts underperforming employees, and builds accountability through real-time insights and tools. Agile performance management enhances productivity and engagement while creating a culture of transparency and adaptability. This shows a shift in culture towards a more performance-driven culture for meaningful results.
In 2025, employee experience will be at the forefront since organizations are coming to understand that engaged employees result in better business outcomes. A good experience includes many things, ranging from onboarding to career growth, offering smooth processes, supportive work environments, and collaboration tools.
Investment in employee experience is a lever by which organizations attract and retain top talent, reduce turnover, and build a strong employer brand. Personalized initiatives based on individual preferences and feedback help create a sense of belonging, loyalty, and motivation.
10. Employee Well-being Programs
With the awareness about mental health, programs that deal with employeesâ€™ well-being are getting much attention these days. In a 2024 survey, employers reported an increase in mental health challenges for 77% of employees, and 16% indicated further growth.
Such organizations answer this challenge by implementing comprehensive employee well-being programs, ranging from mental health resources and flexible work options to wellness initiatives. This enhances productivity, reduces burnout, and builds a supporting culture.
The future of talent management in 2025 centers on adaptability, precision, and a skills-first mindset. As organizations navigate a rapidly evolving landscape, emerging talent management trends such as AI-driven upskilling, internal mobility , personalized learning, and agile performance management are becoming essential pillars of a future-ready workforce strategy.
iMocha plays a critical role in enabling this shift. With its AI-powered skills intelligence cloud, organizations gain the ability to assess competencies, close skill gaps , and design targeted growth paths that align with both employee aspirations and business goals.
What are the key talent management trends?
Some of the current trends in talent management dominating 2025 include skills-based workforce strategies, well-being programs, AI-driven insights, personalized upskilling and reskilling, and agile performance management.
How is AI shaping talent management?
AI helps businesses automate a variety of tasks and processes, such as recruitment. It also helps with tailored upskilling while improving decision-making. It helps predict future trends, discover skill gaps, and more.
How does data-driven talent management benefit organizations?
The data-driven talent management approach offers actionable insights, enhances hiring accuracy, discovers skills gaps, and measures ROI. With this, companies can align workforce strategies with organizational objectives.
What is the biggest trend in talent management for 2025?
Although there are several trends coming up in the talent management landscape, one that stands out is skills-based talent management. It focuses more on the candidateâ€™s skills and not previous jobs or titles.
What KPIs should talent leaders track in 2025?
Some of the KPIs to track in 2025 include skills gap analysis , well-being program participation, internal mobility rates, DEI progress, employee engagement scores, performance metrics, and retention rates.
Page 5/10: Skills Data or Skills Illusion? Validate Workforce Capability
The Skills Credibility Crisis
Every organization today is racing to become skills-first. It's no longer optional-it's strategic imperative. CHROs are launching skills taxonomies. Talent leaders are investing in learning platforms. Business units are demanding workforce agility.
But here's the uncomfortable question nobody's asking: How reliable is your skills data?
If you're like most organizations, the honest answer is: you don't really know.
When Skills Data Becomes Skills Fiction
The irony of the skills revolution is stark. We have more skills data than ever before, yet less confidence in what it actually tells us.
Walk into any large enterprise and you'll find an overwhelming abundance of data points:
â€¢ Resumes and job applicationsfilled with self-proclaimed expertise
â€¢ Learning Management Systemstracking thousands of completed courses
â€¢ Performance reviewswhere managers attest to employee capabilities
â€¢ Certificates and credentialsfrom vendors, bootcamps, and universities
â€¢ LinkedIn profilesshowcasing skills badges and endorsements
â€¢ AI-inferred skillsfrom parsing job descriptions and work history
The problem isn't collecting this data. The problem is trusting it.
Because when skills data lacks credibility, whether intentional or not, it becomes worse than useless-it becomes dangerous. It leads to:
â€¢ Mis-hiresbased on inflated capabilities
â€¢ Failed reskilling programsbuilt on inaccurate baseline assessments
â€¢ Poorinternal mobilitydecisions that set employees up to fail
â€¢ Misallocated L&D budgetsaddressing the wrong capability gaps
â€¢ Strategic blind spotswhere leadership thinks they have skills they don't
The questions haunting talent leaders are straightforward but critical:
â€¢ Which employees truly have validated skills?
â€¢ How much of this data is actually fresh and current?
â€¢ Where are the blind spots across different departments and roles?
â€¢ Can we confidently make talent decisions based on what our systems tell us?
â€ If you can't answer these questions with certainty, you don't have a skills strategy. You have a skills illusion.
The Validation Gap: Why Traditional Skills Data Falls Short
Let's break down why most organizations struggle with skills credibility:
1. Self-Declaration Is Not Validation
The majority of skills data in enterprise systems comes from self-reporting. Employees add skills to their profiles. Candidates list competencies on resumes. Managers affirm capabilities during reviews.
2. Learning Completion â‰  Skill Acquisition
Your LMS shows that 500 employees completed a data analytics course. Does that mean you now have 500 data analysts?
Course completion tells you someone showed up. It doesn't tell you:
â€¢ Whether they retained the knowledge
â€¢ If they can apply it in real-world scenarios
â€¢ How their proficiency compares to role requirements
â€¢ Whether the skill is being actively used or has gone dormant
Yet many organizations treat learning data as if it's skills data. It's not. It's an input, not an outcome.
3. Credentials Show Participation, Not Mastery
Certificates and badges have proliferated. Some are rigorous and meaningful. Many are participation trophies.
â€¢ What the credential actually tested
â€¢ How recently it was earned
â€¢ Whether the skills are being applied
â€¢ How the standard compares to your organizational needs
...credentials become noise, not signal.
4. AI-Inferred Skills Are Educated Guesses
Many modern platforms use AI to infer skills from job descriptions, work history, or project data. This seems elegant until you realize:
â€¢ Job titles are wildly inconsistent across companies
â€¢ Job descriptions often describe aspirational requirements, not actual work
â€¢ Project involvement doesn't equal skill mastery
â€¢ AI can't assess the quality of work or depth of expertise
AI-inferred skills are hypothesis generators. They're not validation.
5. Point-in-Time Snapshots Go Stale Quickly
Even when you do validate skills, that validation has a shelf life. Technical skills evolve rapidly. Business contexts change. Employees move to roles where certain skills go unused and fade.
A skills inventory that's six months old might already be 30% inaccurate. A year-old inventory is essentially historical fiction.
The Cost of Skills Illusion
When organizations make decisions based on unreliable skills data, the consequences ripple across the entire talent lifecycle:
In Hiring: You think you're assessing candidates against validated capability benchmarks, but you're actually comparing them against inflated internal profiles. You hire for "culture fit" because you can't confidently assess skill fit.
In Talent Mobility : High-potential employees get moved into roles where they lack critical skills, not because they're not capable, but because your data showed capabilities that weren't actually there. They struggle, morale suffers, and you label it a "poor fit."
In Workforce Planning : Leadership wants to know "do we have the skills to execute this strategy?" The data says yes. Six months later, you're scrambling to hire externally because the internal capabilities didn't exist.
In Learning Strategy: You're investing millions in upskilling programs designed to close gaps that your data identified. But if the baseline was wrong, you're solving the wrong problem. Learners sit through training for skills they already have or skip training for gaps they don't know exist.
In Strategic Decisions: The board wants to enter a new market or launch a new product. Your workforce analytics indicate you have the technical capabilities needed. You commit. Only then do you discover the skills weren't real.
The stakes are too high for guesswork masquerading as data.
The Breakthrough: From Skills Data to Skills Intelligence
This is where iMocha's Skill Validation Snapshot & Coverage Dashboard transforms the equation. It doesn't give you another view of the same questionable data. It gives you something fundamentally different: truth .
Not a data view. A lens of truth for your workforce skills.
How It Works: Creating Skills Confidence
The Skill Validation Snapshot & Coverage Dashboard consolidates every validation source across your organization into a single, transparent, and actionable view:
â€¢ Assessment scoresfrom role-specific skill validations
â€¢ Certification datawith context about rigor and recency
â€¢ Learning completionstied to demonstrated competency, not just attendance
â€¢ Manager validationsstructured around observable behaviors
â€¢ Self-assessmentsbenchmarked against actual performance data
â€¢ Real-world work samplesand project outcomes
The Power of Transparency: What Leaders Can Now See
The dashboard doesn't just show how many employees claim a skill. It shows how that validation was achieved , creating unprecedented transparency:
â€¢ 45% validated through technical assessments
â€¢ 25% confirmed via recent project work
â€¢ 20% certified with current credentials
â€¢ 10% manager-validated based on observation
This lets you immediately understand: Is this a confident data point or a soft assumption?
Coverage Heatmaps: You can visualize skill coverage across your organization with confidence levels:
â€¢ Green zones:Skills with high validation and coverage
â€¢ Yellow zones:Skills present but with validation gaps
â€¢ Red zones:Critical skill gaps or low-confidence data
No more blind spots. No more surprises.
Individual Validation Profiles: For any employee, you can see:
â€¢ Which skills are strongly validated (recent assessment, applied in work, manager-confirmed)
â€¢ Which skills are self-declared but unvalidated
â€¢ Which skills have become stale (validated >12 months ago, not recently applied)
â€¢ Skill trajectory over time-are they gaining or losing proficiency?
Seeing Progress in Motion: Skills as a Journey, Not a Snapshot
Skill validation isn't a one-time event-it's an ongoing journey. Your workforce is constantly evolving. People are learning, applying, forgetting, and relearning skills continuously.
The Monthly Momentum Section brings that journey to life through visualization:
You can see month-over-month:
â€¢ How many employees are getting skills validated(showing upskilling momentum)
â€¢ How many new skills are being added to profiles(showing organizational skill expansion)
â€¢ Whether validation rates are accelerating or stagnating(showing cultural engagement with skills validation)
This is a leading indicator of organizational learning culture. If validation rates are climbing, your people are actively engaged in growth. If they're flat or declining, it's an early warning sign.
For critical skills that your organization is trying to build:
â€¢ Track how coverage is increasing month by month
â€¢ See which teams are making progress vs. falling behind
â€¢ Identify which reskilling programs are working and which aren't moving the needle
This transforms learning from a compliance checkbox into a measurable capability-building engine.
Is your skills data getting fresher or staler over time?
The dashboard tracks the average freshness score across your organization and shows the trend:
â€¢ Improving freshness:Your validation practices are working, and data confidence is growing
â€¢ Declining freshness:Skills data is aging, and you need to refresh validations or risk making decisions on outdated information
For employees enrolled in development programs, you can visualize their skills journey:
â€¢ Skills at baseline (with confidence levels)
â€¢ Skills post-training (with validation proof)
â€¢ Skills applied in work (with project evidence)
â€¢ Skills mastery over time (showing proficiency growth curves)
This isn't just motivating for learners-it's evidence that your L&D investments are working.
From Guesswork to Confidence: Real-World Applications
Let's look at how the Skills Validation Dashboard transforms critical talent decisions:
Use Case 1: Internal Mobility with Confidence
Before: An employee applies for a senior data engineering role. Their profile shows "Python, SQL, Cloud Architecture" as skills. You move them. Three months later, they're struggling because their Python experience was limited to basic scripts five years ago, and their "cloud architecture" knowledge was theoretical.
After: The dashboard shows:
â€¢ Python: Self-declared, last validated 4 years ago, low freshness score
â€¢ SQL: Assessment-validated 2 months ago, high proficiency, high freshness score
â€¢ Cloud Architecture: Course completed, no real-world application, medium freshness score
You make an informed decision: move them into a role that leverages their strong SQL skills, and provide intensive Python and cloud upskilling with validation checkpoints before considering senior engineering roles.
Use Case 2: Strategic Workforce Planning That's Grounded in Reality
Before: Leadership asks: "Do we have the AI/ML capabilities to build this new product feature in-house?" HR pulls a report showing 50 employees with "Machine Learning" on their profiles. You greenlight an internal build. Six months later, you're behind schedule because most of those employees had only completed an intro course and couldn't architect production ML systems.
â€¢ 50 employees with ML listed
â€¢ Only 8 with assessment-validated proficiency
â€¢ Only 3 with recent project application
â€¢ Only 1 with validated capability at the advanced level needed
You make the strategic call: hire 2-3 external ML engineers to anchor the team, upskill the 8 validated employees to support roles, and build a longer-term capability pipeline. Your timeline is realistic, and the project succeeds.
Use Case 3: Reskilling Programs That Actually Work
Before: You launch a data analytics reskilling program for 200 employees. Post-training surveys show high satisfaction. Six months later, analytics usage hasn't increased, and hiring managers still complain about capability gaps.
â€¢ Pre-training: 200 employees, 15% with validated analytics skills
â€¢ Post-training: 200 employees completed, but only 40% passed validation assessments
â€¢ 3 months later: Only 25% are applying analytics skills in their work (freshness score tracked)
â€¢ 6 months later: Proficiency levels among active users have increased, but coverage remains low
You diagnose the issue: the training was too advanced for most learners' baseline, and there wasn't enough hands-on application baked into workflows. You redesign the program with prerequisites, more practical exercises, and manager-led application projects. The next cohort shows 70% validation rates and 60% sustained application.
You've transformed L&D from a cost center into a measurable capability engine.
Use Case 4: Hiring Decisions Anchored in Reality
Before: You're hiring for a critical role. You want to prioritize internal candidates to build morale and retention. But you're not sure if any internal candidates are truly qualified, so you hedge by opening external searches simultaneously. The process drags on, and internal candidates feel overlooked.
â€¢ 3 internal candidates with relevant skills
â€¢ Candidate A: High validation scores, recent application, clear proficiency trajectory
â€¢ Candidate B: Mixed validation, some gaps but strong foundation
â€¢ Candidate C: Mostly self-declared, low confidence data
You fast-track Candidate A with confidence, offer targeted upskilling to Candidate B as a backup, and focus your external search only if needed. The internal candidate succeeds, morale lifts, and you've saved 3 months of recruiting time.
Building a Culture of Skills Confidence
The Skills Validation Dashboard doesn't just provide data-it creates behavioral change.
When employees see that validated skills unlock opportunities (mobility, projects, development resources), they become invested in validation. It shifts from an HR compliance activity to a career accelerator.

Some of the common skills required to work in this role include:
â€¢ Analyzing trends and patterns
â€¢ Attention to detail
â€¢ Strong communication skills
â€¢ Time management skills
Some of the key certifications required for a career in this field include the following:
â€¢ A Bachelor's Degree in Finance
â€¢ Chartered Financial Analyst certification (CFA)
â€¢ Certified Financial Planner certification (CFP)
â€¢ Licenses issued by the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA)

Upskilling is strengthening current skills to stay competitive in evolving roles. For example: A software developer learning cloud computing to build scalable, future-ready applications.
Reskilling is equipping employees with new skills to shift into different roles. For example: A React developer trained in Angular to contribute across diverse front-end frameworks.

iMochaâ€™s Smart Proctoring Suite uses AI to monitor webcam feeds, screen activity, tab switching, and behavioral anomalies. It generates auto-logs and flags impersonation, inactivity, and policy violations.

The platform is WCAG 2.1 compliant and supports 50+ global languages, ensuring an inclusive and user-friendly experience for candidates of all backgrounds and abilities.
Can organizations create custom assessments using their own questions or criteria?
Absolutely. Organizations can use iMochaâ€™s custom test builder to combine their questions with iMochaâ€™s library, tailor scoring criteria, and align tests with internal role requirements.
What ROI can companies expect from implementing iMochaâ€™s skills assessments?
Organizations typically experience reduced mis-hires, faster time-to-hire, improved candidate quality, and enhanced L&D targetingâ€”leading to higher productivity and better workforce fit.

: At a glance
BRAC Bank started its journey on 4th July, 2001 as a private commercial bank focused on Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs). In just a decade, the Bank has become one of the most preferred banks in Bangladesh, keeping its core focus in SME.
Today BRAC Bank holds a dynamic network of 187 branches, 471 ATMs & CDMs, 457 SME Unit Offices and 594 Agent Banking Outlets across the country. The stakeholders of the bank are BRAC, the largest non-government organization in the world and International Finance Corporation, the private sector arm of The World Bank.
BRAC bank wanted to expand its team and conduct a hiring drive pan Bangladesh. They wanted to hire around 600 candidates for various job roles spreading across 17 divisions.
â€¢ Current recruitment process was not apt for hiring at scale
â€¢ Remote assessments pan Bangladesh were difficult due to logistical and administrative hassles
The former recruitment process was manual and not suitable for hiring at scale. The BRAC bank team wanted to switch to an automated process with deep insights into the skills proficiency.
BRAC bank interacted with iMochaâ€™s team and were impressed with how we help organizations hire at scale using a customized microsite model. iMocha implemented the Microsite structure in two ways:
â€¢ Mapping our existing skills library with the job-role requirement
â€¢ Creating customized assessments where required
Once the logistics were mapped out, iMocha began developing the Microsite that would be hosted on the BRAC bank website for the drive. BRAC bank invited registrations from candidates for the assessments.
Assessments were created for skills such as:
â€¢ Financial Risk Management
â€¢ Ownership & Drivers result
The candidates could choose any 2 divisions and appear for 1 assessment per division. The drive was conducted on 2 days and the link was opened for registered candidates. The candidates could appear for the assessment from anywhere in Bangladesh and the advanced proctoring measures ensured that the integrity of the assessments was maintained.
BRAC bank successfully assessed and evaluated 33,600 candidates in 2 days. The BRAC bank team has leveraged our AI-powered assessment report to shortlist 600 top performers for further interviews. Switching to an online remote assessment platform has helped them save 80% administrative and logistical cost.
Page 7/10: iMocha Helped Capgemini Reduce its Training Costs by 74%
How Capgemini upskilled 3,500+ fresh graduates as well-rounded talent for effective project deployment
Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology, and engineering services, and outsourcing services. In the evolving world of cloud, digital, and platforms, this group is at the forefront of innovation in addressing its clientâ€™s issues and opportunities.
Capgemini's strong 50-year+ heritage and deep industry-specific expertise enable organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations.
The conviction drives Capgemini that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries.
With iMocha, we accurately assessed our employees' skills and provided training where needed. This saved time, reduced manual tasks, prevented cheating, and ensured industry standards were met. Our organization-wide benchmark for English communication allowed us to identify areas for improvement and make informed decisions on training and participation, resulting in better business outcomes.
- Talent Development Leader at Capgemini
Bottlenecks in bench-to-billing - Despite high technical skills, young employees were not being deployed on projects due to poor English communication skils, resulting into empty billable hours and impact on revenue.
Lack of skill benchmarking & training need identification - With a lack of skill benchmarking for business English skills across the organization, identifying skill gaps and training needs would have been costly & time-consuming as it required a new process from scratch.
Lack of holistic evaluation in a single test - There was no tool that could measure performance indicators of business English skills on all four aspects: Listening, Speaking, Reading, Writing.
The Learning & Development leaders at Capgemini collaborated with iMocha to drive business English skill evaluation of 3,500+ fresh graduate employees.
Skill Consulting for Customized Evaluation
The assessments were created to simulate real-world English communication challenges that employees face during project delivery. The program was developed accessing a large library for all four skills - Listening, Speaking, Reading, and Writing - and using a mix of three difficulty levels.
Automated, data-driven evaluation with AI-powered engine â€šÃ„Ã§
With AI-powered engine backed by strong NLP models, Capgemini eliminated time-consuming, manual process and replaced it with fast, automated, accurate scoring at scale to evaluate business English skills for fresher training program.
Skill benchmarking & training need identification
Capgemini measured business English competency of the employees and benchmarked their skills against global CEFR standard.
iMocha reports included comprehensive skill-gap analysis with skill-wise breakdown. The in-depth analytics covered critical performance parameters such as language understanding, readability, oral fluency, grammar, vocabulary and more.
Capgemini zoomed into areas of strength & improvements to identify 26% of employees who had training needs and designed targeted training programs.
Reduction in training costs
By identifying employees who scored lower than the benchmark and needed upskilling, L&D managers saved 74% of training costs and spent only that was necessary. 17% of employees who scored low in English Speaking received targeted training to help them deliver better speeches while managing projects.
Page 8/10: Discover How EY Recruited Top 1% Campus Talent with iMocha
EY hired top 1% campus talent with high business English skills for technology consulting
EY encountered obstacles in recruiting 200+ high-performing fresh graduates from university campuses with strong technical expertise, cognitive aptitude, and proficient business English skills.
The previous manual campus recruitment process entailed demanding schedules, requiring visits to multiple campuses within a tight 4-5 month hiring timeline. This made acquiring talent from 90+ Tier I, II, and III category campuses an extremely time-consuming and resource-intensive initiative.
Furthermore, there was a shortage of assessment questions available to cover all 90+ campuses, posing challenges in preventing leaks. EY also needed a strong mechanism to detect cheating instances and maintain integrity of the assessments for selection of the right candidates.
EY faced a daunting task of hiring 200+ top fresh graduates with high technical knowledge, cognitive aptitude, and effective business English skills from 90+ university campuses within a tight timeline of 4-5 months. iMocha's partnership provided a solution with an automated assessment platform to bring scalability, efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

â€¢ iMocha AI-EnglishPro used AI/ML-driven engine powered by advanced NLP models for automating Speaking and Writing evaluation under business English communication skills.

â€¢ With a large question bank, the platform ensured the questions were randomized to prevent any leaks. - iMocha's AI-powered proctoring ensured the assessments were monitored to detect cheating instances.
â€¢ iMocha's dedicated customer support helped EY throughout campus drives and ensured smooth execution.
EY successfully assessed 23,000+ graduates and postgraduates from 90+ campuses with skill-mapped assessments. They eliminated the cost, resources, time, and effort required for offline campus drives and completed the assessment of all campuses within deadlines.
The online tests maintained 100% integrity for 3,000+ students within a span of 4-5 months. Ultimately, EY hired the top 1% of all-rounded coders from 90+ campuses, proficient in technical as well as business English skills.

Tata Advanced Systems Ltd. (TASL) is a well-positioned company of the Tata Group, which addresses the Government of Indiaâ€™s initiatives to spur indigenous development and manufacturing of critical aerospace and defense solutions. The company has multiple capabilities across the aerospace value chain, be it design & engineering, industrialization, tooling, parts fabrication, and assembly. Traditionally, human invigilators monitored exams physically. But with Xobinâ€™s AI-driven proctoring, most of the supervision is automated. This means real-time detection of suspicious behavior, multiple devices, or unauthorized actions without intruding on the candidateâ€™s privacy.

Key Xobin AI Proctoring Features that Prevent Cheating
Question Shuffle and Randomization
Every test session is unique. Xobin automatically randomizes question order and answer options, making it impossible for candidates to predict or share exact sequences. This eliminates collusion and guarantees fairness across multiple test sessions.
To prevent plagiarism and information sharing, Xobin blocks all cut, copy, and paste operations, including keyboard shortcuts. This ensures that candidates canâ€™t copy questions or search for answers externally.

Xobinâ€™s webcam proctoring utilizes the built-in microphone and camera functionalities to capture continuous video or periodic snapshots throughout the test. This ensures monitoring real-time behavior of candidates without interrupting the test experience.
Xobinâ€™s off-tab activity tracking feature monitors test-takerâ€™s behavior to detect any attempt to navigate away from the assessment window. Using advanced motion analysis, Xobin detects when a candidate leaves their seat or moves out of frame, alerting proctors immediately. This ensures the candidate remains present and attentive during the assessment.
Our system identifies simultaneous device usage, such as smartphones or secondary monitors. Even partially visible devices are detected and flagged, ensuring no external resources are used during the assessment. This feature ensures the assessment remains device-locked and secure.
The AI proctoring system identifies if more than one person appears in the camera frame. This feature assists HR teams in verifying that the right candidate is genuinely attempting the assessment without external assistance.

Which steps to follow on getting an error during Xobin test?
Hi Candidate - Refer to [Candidate FAQs](https://xobin.com/candidate-faq/ ) for your reference.
â€¢ Please follow the below steps in sequential order on getting thefollowing screenshotto immediately fix and take up the test.
â€¢ Reload/refreshthe test interface page. This will not lose any of your previously filled data.
â€¢ Try switching from Wi-Fi to a mobile hotspot, or vice versa, to resolve your internal system issue.
â€¢ Open the test link in theIncognito tab(ctrl+shift+N)
â€¢ Switch to a different Browser. Chrome, Mozilla, and Edge are preferred.
â€¢ If there's hardware issue, means your system is not compatible for proctored test. Switch the system to take up the test.
â€¢ Kindly disable plugins, antivirus, firewalls and deactivate all the extensions installed in your system. Xobin will automatically detect and abandon your test.
â€¢ When you come across this screen, follow the below steps -
â€¢ To setup the correct timezone in your system.Right-clickon the Time&Date in the corner of your system and selectAdjust Date&Time, simply turn on both the first option and set time zone automatically.
Page 8/10: What is proctoring and how to enable webcam proctoring?
What is proctoring and how to enable webcam proctoring?
Proctoring is a technology which aids in remote assessments. It is a feature that allows a test to be taken from any location, wherever the candidate has a computer and a high-speed internet connection. Invigilating via a combination of technologies such as monitoring software, video images prevent the candidates from indulging in any undesirable activities.
Xobin online assessment software allows users to monitor candidates their activity right from the moment they start the test, till they finish. For this purpose, the webcam proctoring feature is available for every test. To enable it,
â€¢ First create the test for which you want to assess the candidates. Test creation can be either of your own or you can use the pre-built tests available in the"My assessments"tab of dashboard.
â€¢ Once you have dropped the test in your dashboard, please select the 3 dots at the end of the test.
â€¢ A modal will be opened with all the test settings and on the top, you could see"Proctoring". Please click the toggle to enable or disable it. Just a click away, it's on.
â€¢ Press"Save"at the end of the modal for the changes to reflect.
For any further queries, kindly connect with us at contact@xobin.com

How to randomize the questions from a pool of questions?
Randomizing a pool of questions, gives different question paper to each candidate. So, how to randomize the questions from a pool of questions?

â€¢ Press on theAssessments Tab.
â€¢ Press the"Pen Icon"on the assessment, for which you want to make changes.
â€¢ The assessment creation page will get open click on Advance Builder
â€¢ It will open the test in"Edit" mode, where all the settings, are there
â€¢ Select theSet custom Rule
â€¢ You will find the option to select the no of quetsion from the selected pool
â€¢ Select and press Save
â€¢ The randomisation feature is applied.

title: Xobin | About Us
metadata: Crawled 10 pages using BFS | Sections: product, products, features, feature, platform
plain_text:
Page 1/10: Xobin | About Us
Xobin is a globally trusted online talent assessment platform, redefining how organizations screen, track, assess, interview, and select top talent. With automation, advanced analytics, customizable tests, and AI-powered proctoring, we simplify hiring processes across campus drives, technical and non-technical roles, and psychometric evaluations. Beyond recruitment, Xobin also helps evaluate employees to identify and close skill gaps.
Trusted by 5000+ customers in 55+ countries and supporting over 4 million+ test-takers each year, we help hiring teams across industries assess candidates for any role or skill in any domain. With our platform, you hire top talents 20x faster and smarter while saving 10x on cost and effort.
Where it all started
It all began in 2016 with a small team of passionate specialists driven by one mission: to make pre-employment skills testing seamless for both recruiters and candidates . That mission continues to guide us even today. Over the years, Xobin has grown into a globally recognized platform that helps hiring teams across the world validate candidate skills with accuracy and confidence. Before scaling up, our founding team was proud to be part of Indiaâ€™s leading startup accelerator, Axilor Ventures, which played a key role in shaping our journey.
Our mission at Xobin is simple yet powerful: to help organizations hire better, faster, and smarter . We believe that talent should be recognized for skills, not just resumes. Thatâ€™s why we design intelligent, cheat-proof talent assessments powered by AI that bring fairness, accuracy, and efficiency to the hiring process. Every feature we build is designed to simplify hiring, enhance candidate experience, and promote a culture of data-backed decision-making.
Our vision at Xobin is to create a world where every hiring decision is guided by skills, not assumptions. Xobin aspires to be the global standard for skill-based recruitment, helping companies of all sizes discover and nurture talent that drives innovation and growth. We envision a future where technology and human insight work together to build diverse, high-performing teams.
Behind Xobinâ€™s success is a dynamic team of thinkers, innovators, and problem-solvers who are passionate about transforming recruitment through technology. Our people come from diverse backgrounds but share a common goal: making skill-based hiring the global standard . Together, we combine deep expertise in HR, technology, and data science to deliver solutions that make recruitment effortless, insightful, and impactful.
Media Coverage and Queries
Xobin has been featured by leading media outlets for our work in revolutionizing recruitment, identifying emerging skill trends, and advancing HR Tech innovation. We regularly publish in-depth Research Reports, E-books, and Whitepapers to share insights on modern hiring practices and industry evolution. For press coverage, interviews, or media inquiries, please reach out to our team at [emailÂ protected]
Page 2/10: Why Enterprises Trust Xobinâ€™s AI Proctoring Features
In todayâ€™s fast-evolving digital recruitment and assessment landscape, maintaining test integrity and candidate trust has become more challenging than ever. Thatâ€™s why top enterprises and fast-growing teams trust Xobinâ€™s advanced AI proctoring features to conduct cheat-proof, fair, and seamless online assessments .
Xobinâ€™s AI-powered proctoring system combines cutting-edge artificial intelligence, machine learning, and behavioral analytics to ensure every test is authentic, secure, and unbiased while offering a stress-free experience for candidates.
Letâ€™s explore how Xobinâ€™s AI-based proctoring technology safeguards your assessments, strengthens employer credibility, and helps you make better, data-driven hiring decisions.
TLDR â€“ Key Takeaways!
â€¢ Question Shuffle and Randomization:Every test is unique; no two candidates get the same question order.
â€¢ Cut/Copy/Paste disabling:Stops content theft by disabling all shortcuts and clipboard actions.
â€¢ Right-Click Disabled:Blocks access to browser tools and unauthorized windows.
â€¢ Keystore/Keystroke recording in coding questions:Captures every keystroke in coding tests to verify code originality.
â€¢ Off-tab monitoring:Instantly flags candidates who switch tabs or browse elsewhere.
â€¢ Webcam Recording:Clicks real-time snapshots of the candidate periodically.
â€¢ Absentee Detection:Checks if the candidate has blocked their camera or left the seat.
â€¢ Multiple Face Detection:Detects the presence of more than one person in the test background.
â€¢ Multi-Device Detection:Detects presence of visible/partially visible phone, book or TV Screen.
â€¢ Screen Recording:Captures every on-screen action and browser movement in real time.
â€¢ Eye Tracking:Records if the candidate is excessively gazing away from the monitor.
â€¢ Audio Proctoring:Monitors background noise to detect conversations or external guidance.
â€¢ XoLock Secure Browser:Get a dedicated exam browser that blocks all external applications and extensions.
â€¢ Real-time Live Proctoring:Humans can monitor small batches of candidates in real time.
â€¢ Plagiarism Detection:AI scans written and code responses for originality of answers.
â€¢ Non-Googleable Questions:Get access to custom questions which canâ€™t be found online.
â€¢ AI Trust Score:Generates integrity score based on candidates behavior and activity.
What is Online Proctoring?
Online proctoring refers to the process of supervising candidates remotely during online assessments to ensure fairness and prevent cheating.
Traditionally, human invigilators monitored exams physically. But with Xobinâ€™s AI-driven proctoring, most of the supervision is automated. This means real-time detection of suspicious behavior, multiple devices, or unauthorized actions without intruding on the candidateâ€™s privacy.

Key Xobin AI Proctoring Features that Prevent Cheating
Question Shuffle and Randomization
Every test session is unique. Xobin automatically randomizes question order and answer options, making it impossible for candidates to predict or share exact sequences. This eliminates collusion and guarantees fairness across multiple test sessions.

Xobinâ€™s webcam proctoring utilizes the built-in microphone and camera functionalities to capture continuous video or periodic snapshots throughout the test. This ensures monitoring real-time behavior of candidates without interrupting the test experience.

Using advanced motion analysis, Xobin detects when a candidate leaves their seat or moves out of frame, alerting proctors immediately. This ensures the candidate remains present and attentive during the assessment.
Our system identifies simultaneous device usage, such as smartphones or secondary monitors. Even partially visible devices are detected and flagged, ensuring no external resources are used during the assessment. This feature ensures the assessment remains device-locked and secure.
The AI proctoring system identifies if more than one person appears in the camera frame. This feature assists HR teams in verifying that the right candidate is genuinely attempting the assessment without external assistance.
Screen Recording & Browser Activity Monitoring
Xobin records the entire screen session, capturing every movement and browser tab opened. All browser tabs, window switches, and navigations are tracked in real time. Any attempt to visit external pages or open new windows is instantly flagged.
Using advanced eye-tracking technology, Xobin monitors gaze direction to detect if the candidate frequently looks away from the screen, a common indicator of external help. Frequent off-screen gazes trigger real-time alerts for potential misconduct.
Audio Recording & Real-Time Analysis

Xobin offers a secure browser environment that blocks all external applications, pop-ups, and unauthorized access. It restricts 90% of external app access, creating a closed and distraction-free environment.

Page 3/10: Why Enterprises Trust Xobinâ€™s AI Proctoring Features
In todayâ€™s fast-evolving digital recruitment and assessment landscape, maintaining test integrity and candidate trust has become more challenging than ever. Thatâ€™s why top enterprises and fast-growing teams trust Xobinâ€™s advanced AI proctoring features to conduct cheat-proof, fair, and seamless online assessments .
Xobinâ€™s AI-powered proctoring system combines cutting-edge artificial intelligence, machine learning, and behavioral analytics to ensure every test is authentic, secure, and unbiased while offering a stress-free experience for candidates.
Letâ€™s explore how Xobinâ€™s AI-based proctoring technology safeguards your assessments, strengthens employer credibility, and helps you make better, data-driven hiring decisions.
TLDR â€“ Key Takeaways!
â€¢ Question Shuffle and Randomization:Every test is unique; no two candidates get the same question order.
â€¢ Cut/Copy/Paste disabling:Stops content theft by disabling all shortcuts and clipboard actions.
â€¢ Right-Click Disabled:Blocks access to browser tools and unauthorized windows.
â€¢ Keystore/Keystroke recording in coding questions:Captures every keystroke in coding tests to verify code originality.
â€¢ Off-tab monitoring:Instantly flags candidates who switch tabs or browse elsewhere.
â€¢ Webcam Recording:Clicks real-time snapshots of the candidate periodically.
â€¢ Absentee Detection:Checks if the candidate has blocked their camera or left the seat.
â€¢ Multiple Face Detection:Detects the presence of more than one person in the test background.
â€¢ Multi-Device Detection:Detects presence of visible/partially visible phone, book or TV Screen.
â€¢ Screen Recording:Captures every on-screen action and browser movement in real time.
â€¢ Eye Tracking:Records if the candidate is excessively gazing away from the monitor.
â€¢ Audio Proctoring:Monitors background noise to detect conversations or external guidance.
â€¢ XoLock Secure Browser:Get a dedicated exam browser that blocks all external applications and extensions.
â€¢ Real-time Live Proctoring:Humans can monitor small batches of candidates in real time.
â€¢ Plagiarism Detection:AI scans written and code responses for originality of answers.
â€¢ Non-Googleable Questions:Get access to custom questions which canâ€™t be found online.
â€¢ AI Trust Score:Generates integrity score based on candidates behavior and activity.
What is Online Proctoring?
Online proctoring refers to the process of supervising candidates remotely during online assessments to ensure fairness and prevent cheating.
Traditionally, human invigilators monitored exams physically. But with Xobinâ€™s AI-driven proctoring, most of the supervision is automated. This means real-time detection of suspicious behavior, multiple devices, or unauthorized actions without intruding on the candidateâ€™s privacy.
Whether youâ€™re an HR leader, recruiter, or educator, Xobinâ€™s proctoring suite guarantees the security and integrity of every online test.
Why Xobinâ€™s AI Proctoring Stands Out
Unlike conventional monitoring tools, Xobinâ€™s proctoring solution offers a multi-layered security approach. It integrates AI algorithms, real-time analytics, and customizable controls, allowing organizations to create the perfect balance between strict invigilation and candidate comfort.
Hereâ€™s how Xobin helps you conduct cheat-proof assessments with AI-powered precision.
Key Xobin AI Proctoring Features that Prevent Cheating
Question Shuffle and Randomization
Every test session is unique. Xobin automatically randomizes question order and answer options, making it impossible for candidates to predict or share exact sequences. This eliminates collusion and guarantees fairness across multiple test sessions.
To prevent plagiarism and information sharing, Xobin blocks all cut, copy, and paste operations, including keyboard shortcuts. This ensures that candidates canâ€™t copy questions or search for answers externally.
Right-click menus are completely disabled during tests, ensuring candidates canâ€™t use browser developer tools, inspect elements or open any unauthorized windows.
Keystroke Recording in Coding Tests
For coding assessments , Xobin records every keystroke to identify a candidateâ€™s unique typing pattern. This allows evaluators to verify code originality and detect any external code import.
Xobinâ€™s webcam proctoring utilizes the built-in microphone and camera functionalities to capture continuous video or periodic snapshots throughout the test. This ensures monitoring real-time behavior of candidates without interrupting the test experience.
Xobinâ€™s off-tab activity tracking feature monitors test-takerâ€™s behavior to detect any attempt to navigate away from the assessment window. If a candidate attempts to switch tabs or access other applications during the assessment, the system immediately flags any off-tab activity and they are promptly warned about the violation of exam rules.
Persistent disregard for warnings may result in disqualification from the exam.
PS: Warnings are given to candidates.
Using advanced motion analysis, Xobin detects when a candidate leaves their seat or moves out of frame, alerting proctors immediately. This ensures the candidate remains present and attentive during the assessment.
Our system identifies simultaneous device usage, such as smartphones or secondary monitors. Even partially visible devices are detected and flagged, ensuring no external resources are used during the assessment. This feature ensures the assessment remains device-locked and secure.
The AI proctoring system identifies if more than one person appears in the camera frame. This feature assists HR teams in verifying that the right candidate is genuinely attempting the assessment without external assistance.
Screen Recording & Browser Activity Monitoring
Xobin records the entire screen session, capturing every movement and browser tab opened. All browser tabs, window switches, and navigations are tracked in real time. Any attempt to visit external pages or open new windows is instantly flagged.
Using advanced eye-tracking technology, Xobin monitors gaze direction to detect if the candidate frequently looks away from the screen, a common indicator of external help. Frequent off-screen gazes trigger real-time alerts for potential misconduct.
Audio Recording & Real-Time Analysis
Through microphone access, Xobin captures and analyzes background noise, detecting conversations or other forms of unauthorized help. Every sound event is analyzed in real-time by AI for accurate flagging.
Xobin offers a secure browser environment that blocks all external applications, pop-ups, and unauthorized access. It restricts 90% of external app access, creating a closed and distraction-free environment.
Xobin also offers live human proctoring for added security. Trained proctors oversee small candidate batches, ensuring no suspicious behavior goes unnoticed.
Xobin scans codes or subjective answers of candidates to detect plagiarism or duplicate content. Detailed proctoring reports help recruiters identify originality of assessment and candidate integrity.
These are custom-built questions which can not be searched on the web, require critical thinking and personal interpretation to answer the question.
AI Trust Score Algorithm
At the end of each test, Xobinâ€™s Trust Score evaluates a candidateâ€™s overall integrity based on multiple proctoring signals. This helps recruiters instantly identify which candidates took the test honestly and which ones might require review.
Why Enterprises Choose Xobin for Secure Online Assessments
Xobinâ€™s AI proctoring system is trusted by enterprises and fast-scaling startups for its ability to deliver secure, fair, and scalable talent assessments.

As the world shifts toward remote-first recruitment, Xobinâ€™s AI proctoring suite ensures your assessments stay fair, secure, and candidate-friendly.

What is Online Proctoring?
Online proctoring refers to the process of supervising candidates remotely during online assessments to ensure fairness and prevent cheating.
Traditionally, human invigilators monitored exams physically. But with Xobinâ€™s AI-driven proctoring, most of the supervision is automated. This means real-time detection of suspicious behavior, multiple devices, or unauthorized actions without intruding on the candidateâ€™s privacy.
Whether youâ€™re an HR leader, recruiter, or educator, Xobinâ€™s proctoring suite guarantees the security and integrity of every online test.
Why Xobinâ€™s AI Proctoring Stands Out
Unlike conventional monitoring tools, Xobinâ€™s proctoring solution offers a multi-layered security approach. It integrates AI algorithms, real-time analytics, and customizable controls, allowing organizations to create the perfect balance between strict invigilation and candidate comfort.

Key Xobin AI Proctoring Features that Prevent Cheating
Question Shuffle and Randomization
Every test session is unique. Xobin automatically randomizes question order and answer options, making it impossible for candidates to predict or share exact sequences. This eliminates collusion and guarantees fairness across multiple test sessions.
To prevent plagiarism and information sharing, Xobin blocks all cut, copy, and paste operations, including keyboard shortcuts. This ensures that candidates canâ€™t copy questions or search for answers externally.
Right-click menus are completely disabled during tests, ensuring candidates canâ€™t use browser developer tools, inspect elements or open any unauthorized windows.
Keystroke Recording in Coding Tests
For coding assessments , Xobin records every keystroke to identify a candidateâ€™s unique typing pattern. This allows evaluators to verify code originality and detect any external code import.
Xobinâ€™s webcam proctoring utilizes the built-in microphone and camera functionalities to capture continuous video or periodic snapshots throughout the test. This ensures monitoring real-time behavior of candidates without interrupting the test experience.
Xobinâ€™s off-tab activity tracking feature monitors test-takerâ€™s behavior to detect any attempt to navigate away from the assessment window. If a candidate attempts to switch tabs or access other applications during the assessment, the system immediately flags any off-tab activity and they are promptly warned about the violation of exam rules.
Persistent disregard for warnings may result in disqualification from the exam.

Using advanced motion analysis, Xobin detects when a candidate leaves their seat or moves out of frame, alerting proctors immediately. This ensures the candidate remains present and attentive during the assessment.
Our system identifies simultaneous device usage, such as smartphones or secondary monitors. Even partially visible devices are detected and flagged, ensuring no external resources are used during the assessment. This feature ensures the assessment remains device-locked and secure.
The AI proctoring system identifies if more than one person appears in the camera frame. This feature assists HR teams in verifying that the right candidate is genuinely attempting the assessment without external assistance.
Screen Recording & Browser Activity Monitoring
Xobin records the entire screen session, capturing every movement and browser tab opened. All browser tabs, window switches, and navigations are tracked in real time. Any attempt to visit external pages or open new windows is instantly flagged.
Using advanced eye-tracking technology, Xobin monitors gaze direction to detect if the candidate frequently looks away from the screen, a common indicator of external help. Frequent off-screen gazes trigger real-time alerts for potential misconduct.

Through microphone access, Xobin captures and analyzes background noise, detecting conversations or other forms of unauthorized help. Every sound event is analyzed in real-time by AI for accurate flagging.
Xobin offers a secure browser environment that blocks all external applications, pop-ups, and unauthorized access. It restricts 90% of external app access, creating a closed and distraction-free environment.
Xobin also offers live human proctoring for added security. Trained proctors oversee small candidate batches, ensuring no suspicious behavior goes unnoticed.

Whatâ€™s an Automated Video Interview ?
An Automated Video Interview(AVI), also known as an on-demand video interview, is a method of interviewing where a candidate responds to a series of preset screening questions via video format. The interviewer watches this video recording rather than connecting with the candidate in real-time
Automated Video Interviews are all about convenience and flexibility. For both, the candidate and the hiring team. Telephonic Interviews and Round-1 Interviews take up a bulk of the time and effort. title: Best Free & Paid Coding Assessment Platforms in 2026
